To save changes made to a jTable, you can use the DefaultTableModel class. You can modify the data in the table model and then fire a property change event to notify the UI that the data has changed. Here is an example of how you can do this:

1. Create a DefaultTableModel object to hold the data for the jTable.
2. Modify the data in the table model.
3. Fire a property change event to notify the UI that the data has changed.

Here is an example of how you can do this:
```java
DefaultTableModel model = new DefaultTableModel();
// Modify the data in the table model
model.addRow(new Object[]{"1", "2", "3"});

// Fire a property change event to notify the UI that the data has changed
model.fireTableDataChanged();
```
You can add a save button to your program that calls this code when it is clicked. When the button is clicked, the changes made to the jTable will be saved.
